page.title: 12EMPLOYMENT IN NEWTOWN AREA
page.content: There are very few opportunities for employment, most of the farmers and businesses, including the shop are worked by the family with perhaps one employee and part-time seasonal help. Two exceptions are (a) The Meon Valley Nurseries where Mr.Gamblin employs local labour at peak times in the production of 130,000 plants,grown under 1,600 sq.ft. of heated glass and sold to local shops, garden centres and in London.(b) Newtown Garage uses several mechanics and a petrol pump attendant. However the majority of people are professional. A question asked to newcomers is "Are you Naval, a teacher or at I.B.M.?" Our small survey confirmed this and showed that many mothers with a profession return to work when their children are of school age.
